body:
I cannot reproduce, how did you generate the app?

Unless you specified `--skip-action-mailer` you should have the correct files, and the require should be `rails/all` in app.rb.

Thank you for the reminder! It's been a bit since I generated the app and forgot that would be helpful. 

The exact flags I used were

```shell
rails new appname --skip-action-mailer --skip-action-mailbox --css=tailwind
```

I think the authentication generator should account for skipping action mailer and it's valid to want to have auth without sending emails 

Thanks for the quick reply!

Do you want to try and open a PR?

Password reset feels like a must-have, so if you don't have actionmailer the generator should probably fail.

I'm working on one. I just got the devcontainer working so I can run tests.

I was unsure what was the best path on a fix. In my case, I am working on a small prototype so I don't need to worry about emails or password reset just yet. I was planning on re-running the generator later when things were more "real" to pick up the reset email stuff.

Do you think it's reasonable to account for that case? Or, from your experience, would it be better overall to error and require actionmailer?

I think the generator can check if ActionMailer is loaded and if ApplicationMailer is defined, something like:

```diff
diff --git a/railties/lib/rails/generators/rails/authentication/authentication_generator.rb b/railties/lib/rails/generators/rails/authentication/a
uthentication_generator.rb
index f23ba7b2e1..b274b235cb 100644
--- a/railties/lib/rails/generators/rails/authentication/authentication_generator.rb
+++ b/railties/lib/rails/generators/rails/authentication/authentication_generator.rb
@@ -21,7 +21,9 @@ def create_authentication_files

         template "app/channels/application_cable/connection.rb" if defined?(ActionCable::Engine)

-        template "app/mailers/passwords_mailer.rb"
+        if has_action_mailer?
+          template "app/mailers/passwords_mailer.rb"
+        end

         template "app/views/passwords_mailer/reset.html.erb"
         template "app/views/passwords_mailer/reset.text.erb"
@@ -53,6 +55,13 @@ def add_migrations
       end

       hook_for :test_framework
+
+      private
+
+      def has_action_mailer?
+        (defined?(ActionMailer::Base) && defined?(ApplicationMailer)) ||
+          raise "Action Mailer is not defined in the application"
+      end
```

issue.title: Generate mailer files in auth generator only if ActionMailer is used
issue.body:
### Motivation / Background

This Pull Request has been created because if the authentication generator is run in an app created with `--skip-action-mailer`, the app will be silently broken. When deployed to an environment where `eager_load` is true, the app will fail to start as the generated `PasswordMailer` inherits from a nonexistent `ApplicationMailer`.

Fixes #54501 

### Detail

This Pull Request changes the authentication generator to skip all of the mailer-related files if `ActionMailer` is not defined. Also leave `PasswordsController#create` as blank to be implemented by the user.

### Additional information

In my use case, a simple login was enough, and I created user(s) manually in a console. I do not need a password reset flow. An alternative approach would be to require an app to have `ActionMailer` to run the generator.

### Checklist

Before submitting the PR make sure the following are checked:

* [x] This Pull Request is related to one change. Unrelated changes should be opened in separate PRs.
* [x] Commit message has a detailed description of what changed and why. If this PR fixes a related issue include it in the commit message. Ex: `[Fix #issue-number]`
* [x] Tests are added or updated if you fix a bug or add a feature.
